header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Talking about how much someone likes their job and career professional development ideas. Young people today. Talking about a colleague at work.
header.activity: A couple talking about their jobs and other people's jobs
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, complaining, advising, anecdote telling

speaker.fls: French -- level unspecified; German -- level unspecified

body.u: well I at the time I would have been talking about erm particular well not talking about I would have been talking of particular characters that I was working with yeah
were they likeable characters?
not really
no they didn't sound very likeable so you're saying it's more complicated than that

well I d I I think more the point was that it was erm simply er if you're dissatisfied in your job and you're not getting the opportunities that you're looking for either there's a problem on your side or there's a problem on the other side yeah? and the fact is is that the two of you don't meet somewhere in a zone where you can work together and part of that will be poor management that I had an awareness of what I think modern management is and the people that I was working with didn't operate under modern management they ooperated what I would have thought was cold hard old boy style old-school management styles you know

I know but I love the fact that also you and used to go down to the pub every single fucking with a rebellious you know spirit which was I'll fucking turn into work when I want if I don't fucking go into work who cares I'm a fucking contractor I'll go when I want to go there's something that changed in you and you got different you went different about things you got more serious about things and it was around the time you met me

erm well whawhat changed was that I went from being a contractor to being erm a a one of the people on the books with the company and part of the reason for it was that I could see as a contractor people wouldn't choose to take you seriously and allow you to grow in the sense that you needed to

but but contractor suited you in your early twenti I mean sorry your late twenties because you were your own man you had your own company you know that woman was doing the accounting for you I'm not quite sure who it was or if that you were still actually running your own show you were in control

aeronautical engineering?

and he yeah and he has now become a chartered civil engineer and er has his own patch within the company you know and he's a specialist in some particular things and that's because he chose a certain line to go down and from his point of view he might find that he gets rather bored with that but what he's selling is a product that for a company is saleable around the world
mm

erm he has expertise in it and until the the the the environment changes so that product is no longer focused or our money isn't spent on it by government and so on and it's all about public transport then he will still have a job in it he might not enjoy doing it day in and day out but he gets on and he does it cos from my point of view if you do something forever for a long time it gets a bit boring erm if it's something I'm passionate about it won't because I will just continue to learn more and if he's interested in something called butbus rapid transit and that rocks his boat and he wants to spend his career doing that then fine but you wouldn't find me doing it more than five years I would go I'll give it a shot and then I would have had to find something else to do and and part of it comes off the back of probably something a lecturer said when I was at uni which was don't do job for more than five years
why did you not pursue the land surveying?

well when I came from New Zealand to erm to to England it wasn't the same job the same job didn't exist erm we had a very project management based role when we were working in New Zealand and then when we got to England the reality of it was in in England they use the work surveyor for a variety of different things you could be a plumber and be a surveyor you could be a building surveyor you could be a land surveyor you could be erm you you could be electrical surveyor you know you could be an insurance surveyor all of these kind of things and he uses it in its true sense but the thing is is in New Zealand surveyor and in Australia surveyors were important because they were the people who set out the land they were the people who did a lot of exploration and adventure up front
yeah yeah
so erm a lot of what we have been trained in didn't apply in the same context in the UK
